enumerate:
\begin{enumerate}
\item The ``generic'' or ``reducible'' Jordan family:\\
\begin{equation} \mathcal{M} = \
\frac{SO(\ensuremath{\tilde{n}}-1,1)}{SO(\ensuremath{\tilde{n}}-1)}\times SO(1,1), \qquad \ensuremath{\tilde{n}}\geq
1.\nonumber \end{equation}

\item The ``irreducible'' or ``magical'' Jordan family
\footnote{The name ``magical'' derives from the deep
connection with the ``magic square'' of Freudenthal,
Rosenfeld and Tits \cite{FRT}.} .
\begin{eqnarray}
\mathcal{M}&=& SL(3,\mathbb{R})/
SO(3)\qquad
(\ensuremath{\tilde{n}}=5)\nonumber\cr
\mathcal{M}&=& SL(3,\mathbb{C})/
SU(3)\qquad
(\ensuremath{\tilde{n}}=8)\nonumber\cr
\mathcal{M}&=& SU^{*}(6)/
Usp(6)\qquad
(\ensuremath{\tilde{n}}=14)\nonumber\cr
\mathcal{M}    &=& E_{6(-26)}/
F_{4}\qquad \qquad
(\ensuremath{\tilde{n}}=26)\nonumber
\end{eqnarray}


\item  The symmetric non-Jordan family:
\begin{equation}\mathcal{M}=\frac{SO(1,\ensuremath{\tilde{n}})}{SO(\ensuremath{\tilde{n}})},\quad \ensuremath{\tilde{n}}>1.
\end{equation}.
\

\begin{enumerate}
\item $J=\mathbb{R}\oplus \Sigma_{\ensuremath{\tilde{n}}}$ for the generic
Jordan family with the scalar manifolds
\[ \mathcal{M} =
\frac{SO(\tilde{n}-1,1)}{SO(\tilde{n}-1)}\times
SO(1,1) \ .
\] Here, $\Sigma_{\ensuremath{\tilde{n}}}$ is a Jordan algebra of degree $p=2$
associated with a quadratic norm form in $\ensuremath{\tilde{n}}$ dimensions that
has a ``Minkowskian signature'' $(+,-,\ldots,-)$.
A simple realization of $\Sigma_{\ensuremath{\tilde{n}}}$ is provided by $(\ensuremath{\tilde{n}}-1)$ Dirac
gamma matrices $\gamma^i$
$(i,j,\ldots=1,\ldots,(\ensuremath{\tilde{n}}-1))$ of an $(\ensuremath{\tilde{n}}-1)$ dimensional Euclidean
space together with the identity matrix $
\gamma^0 = \mathbf{1}$  and the Jordan product $\circ$ being one half the
anticommutator:

\begin{eqnarray}
\gamma^i \circ \gamma^j &=& \frac{1}{2}
\{\gamma^i,\gamma^j\}= \delta^{ij} \mathbf{1}
\nonumber \\
\gamma^0 \circ \gamma^0 &=& \frac{1}{2}
\{\gamma^0,\gamma^0\}= \mathbf{1}\nonumber\\
\gamma^i \circ \gamma^0 &=& \frac{1}{2}
\{\gamma^i,\gamma^0\}= \gamma^i \ .
\end{eqnarray}
  The norm of a general element $X = X_0 \gamma^0 + X_i \gamma^i $ of
$\Sigma_{\ensuremath{\tilde{n}}}$
is defined as
\[  N(X) = \frac{1}{2^{[\ensuremath{\tilde{n}}/2]}} \textrm{Tr}
X \bar{X} = X_0X_0 - X_iX_i \ ,  \] where
\[ \bar{X} \equiv  X_0 \gamma^0 - X_i \gamma^i  \ . \] 
 The norm of a general element $y \oplus X $ of the non simple
Jordan algebra $J=\mathbb{R}\oplus \Sigma_{\ensuremath{\tilde{n}}}$ is
simply given by $y N(X)$ (cf eq. (\ref{genJorpol})).
 \item The magical
Jordan family corresponds to the four \emph{simple} Euclidean Jordan algebras
of degree 3. These simple Jordan algebras are denoted by $J_3^{\mathbb{R}}$,
$J_3^{\mathbb{C}}$, $J_3^{\mathbb{H}}$, $J_3^{\mathbb{O}}$ and 
are isomorphic to the Hermitian $(3\times 3)$-matrices over the four
division algebras $\mathbb{R}, \mathbb{C},
\mathbb{H}, \mathbb{O}$ with the product being one half the anticommutator:
\begin{eqnarray}\label{magicals}
J_{3}^{\mathbb{R}}:\quad \mathcal{M}&=& SL(3,\mathbb{R})/
SO(3)\qquad
(\ensuremath{\tilde{n}}=5)\nonumber\\
J_{3}^{\mathbb{C}}:\quad \mathcal{M}&=& SL(3,\mathbb{C})/
SU(3)\qquad
(\ensuremath{\tilde{n}}=8)\nonumber\\
J_{3}^{\mathbb{H}}:\quad \mathcal{M}&=& SU^{*}(6)/
Usp(6)\qquad
(\ensuremath{\tilde{n}}=14) \nonumber \\
J_{3}^{\mathbb{O}}:\quad \mathcal{M}&=& E_{6(-26)}/
F_{4}\qquad \qquad
(\ensuremath{\tilde{n}}=26) \ .
\end{eqnarray}
\
